intro: Hiraea cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hiraea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Hiraea cuneata is often found in understory vegetation and is not widely cultivated for commercial purposes.
